React Components

The first thing we will learn about is React Components. React components are the basic building blocks of every expo application. Components are created by extending the React Component class.


        import React, {Component} from "react"

        /**
          Component
          @description component description
        */
        export default class ComponentName extends Component {}

Each Component has a render function. You use the render function to show the visuals for the Component. Render functions consist of JSX code. JSX code is a mix of XML, and JavaScript code. Any JavaScript code within the XML will be surrounded by curly braces. Below is an example of a render function. 


            render() {
              return (
                <View>
                  <Text>
                    Example Text
                  </Text>
                </View>
              )
            }

The text tags surrounding "Example Text" are reference to another component. The View tag is yet another component. There are a ton of components that you can look at here. To use one component in another components render method, all you need to do is put tags for it in the render function. Lets say for example we have Component1, and Component2. If we want to render Component1 in component2 we can go like this: 


            render() {
              return (
                <Component1>
                </Component1>
              )
            }

Even more simply like this


            render() {
              return ( <Component1 /> )
            }

Since you only need opening and closing tags if you are going to put something within those tags.

  1. Create a folder called components in the root of your project directory.
  2. In that directory create two files, one called Cell.js, and one called TicTacToeBoard.js

  3. In the Cell.js file create a class called Cell and add a render method with a text component surrounded by a view component. In the text tag put whatever you want, we will change that later. A cell will be one of the components that make up the tic tac toe board. 

    
import React, {Component} from "react"
import {Text, View} from "react-native"

/**
  Cell
  @description Holds all the cells for the board.
*/
export default class TicTacToeBoard extends Component {
  render() {
    return (
      <View>
        <Text>_</Text>
      </View>
    )
  }
}

  4. In the TicTacToeBoard.js directory create a class called TicTacToeBoard. Create a render method that renders one instance the cell component. This will hold all the cells for the board 

    
import React, {Component} from "react"
import Cell from "./Cell.js"

/**
  TicTacToeBoard
  @description Holds all the cells for the board.
*/
export default class TicTacToeBoard extends Component {
  render() {
    return (
      <Cell />
    )
  }
}

  5. In the App.js file, replace all the code in the return statement of the app function with a TicTacToeBoard component nested in a SafeAreaView. The SafeAreaView is a React Native component that makes your views mobile friendly. 

    
  import React from "react"
  import {SafeAreaView} from "react-native";
  import TicTacToeBoard from "./components/TicTacToeBoard.js"

  /**
    TicTacToeBoard
    @description Holds all the cells for the board.
  */
  export default function App() {
    return (
      <SafeAreaView>
        <TicTacToeBoard />
      </SafeAreaView>
    )
  }
